name: sweet gas, burned in gas turbine | sweet gas, burned in gas turbine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26798/documentation

Burning of sweet natural gas in a turbine for on-site electricity generation in the production of crude petroleum oil and natural gas.;Following the approach of Meili et al. (2021), region-specific emission data for the overall production of crude oil and natural gas are considered for CH4, NOx and SO2 (as described in chapters 9.2 and 9.5 in Meili et al., 2021). Only the remaining combustion gases released are included in this inventory for sweet natural gas burned in gas turbine.;Source: C. Meili, N. Jungbluth, M. Bussa (2021) Life cycle inventories of crude oil and natural gas extraction. ESU-services Ltd. commissioned by the Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) and the â€œVerband der Schweizerischen Gasindustrie (VSG), Schaffhausen, Switzerland, DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.29142.78409, http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/



Providing of compression energy by the exploitation of (sweet) gas fields.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Average of 1999-2000 is used for CH4, CO2, NMVOC, NO2 (data from the Norwegian offshore combined production). Data for CO, N2O, SO2, Hg, Radon-222 and waste heat are based on data from 1991 in Frischknecht et al. 1996, Tab. V.6.7.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for infrastructure requirements, CO2, CO and NMVOC is based on Norwegian data, data for the rest is not geographically defined.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The main part of the inventory is based on the Norwegian data (offshore combined production). No information about technology. As the data is an average over all gas turbines, motors and boilers in the Norwegian gas and oil production it can be assumed that different technologies are represented.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated from norwegian dataset. Uncertainty is adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data is based on the annual reports on emissions and discharges submitted by each individual operator. The emissions and discharges are estimated
according to guidelines given by the Norwegian authorities and OLF (Norwegian Oil Industry Association)

exchanges.description: Input of oxygen from air, balanced stoichometrically against emissions of CO, CO2, NOx, and SO2. Uncertainty set equal to that of CO2.

Literature value (environmental report for Norway).
